snippet: Officials said Dmitri Sokolov, 21, admitted during a prolonged standoff that he had made the explosive belt that was detonated last month in Volgograd.
abstract: Russian security forces kill Dmitri Sokolov, husband of suicide bomber Naida Asiyalova, and four other men identified as Muslim rebels in standoff in violence-plagued republic of Dagestan.
lead_paragraph: Officials said Dmitri Sokolov, 21, admitted during a prolonged standoff that he had made the explosive belt that was detonated last month in Volgograd.

headline.main: Russian Manhunt Ends as Bus Bomber’s Husband Is Killed
headline.print_headline: Russian Manhunt Ends as Bus Bomber’s Husband Is Killed
